statement.tex: %text Let A be a square matrix of order $3\times 3$. Write the value of $|2A|$, where $|A|=4$. %

step.context: %text A $3\times 3$ matrix is multiplied by a constant value 2. How many elements of the matrix are affected by this operation? %
step.tex: %text $9$ - all the elements in the matrix. %
%text $3$ - all the elements in one row. %
step.reason: %text When a matrix is multiplied by a constant, all of the elements in the matrix are multiplied by that constant. %

step.context: %text $3\times 3$ matrix $A$ is multiplied by 2, and the resulting matrix is called $B$. What is $|B|$ if $|A|=4$? ($|A|=$ Determinant $A$, $|B|=$ Determinant $B$) %
